job_title: Registered Nurse in Tampa, FL
pros: The benefits are pretty good, health insurance, maternity leave, tuition reimbersment. Overall i think this hospital is one of the better ones in the Tampa Bay area.
cons: The downside is it can be a bit corpoate. You only get a maximum amout of 5 call outs per year, and you have to request off work far in advance. For example it's Aug 24th and I need to put in any requests to get off in jan/feb of next year. So that can be kinda hard to plan things. I have to work 5-6 weekend shift every 6 weeks as well and 2 holidays every year (including only thanksiving, christmas and new years). If you can deal with that plus the 12+ hour shifts on your feet (buy good shoes) then go for it.

review_title: A good place to work so far.
job_title: Histotechnologist in Tampa, FL
pros: It may be better pay than other privates companies.
cons: Your PTO is used for sick, holidays, vacations.

job_title: Laboratory Assistant II in Tampa, FL
pros: St. Joseph's Hospital is a great company to work for. The pay is great, the employees are easy to work with. The managers are easy going and do not put allot of pressure on you like other hospitals I've worked for before have. I am so grateful to be a part of this team.
cons:
The patients can be pretty brutal. Combative, confused or Baker Acts. 
Lots of walking. 
However, this occurs at other hospitals as well.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Orange, CA
pros: Great staff, teamwork, and work culture. Majority are willing to help you. Great learning environment for a new grad.
cons: Outdated equipment. Disorganized systems. They cut corners a lot with LOA, floating nurses, cheaper supplies just to save a quick buck. High turnover rate due to not competitive pay and subpar benefits.

job_title: Lab Assistant in Lutz, FL
pros: Nice people and great schedule
cons: Management could be a bit nicer

job_title: Cook in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Friendly co-workers and management, nice work environment and many opportunities for growth in the company.
cons: There were no cons when working here.

job_title: Patient Support Technician in Tampa, FL

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Tampa, FL
pros: Fast pace environment, great coworkers, and supportive managers. You learn multiple skills that you can get from a retail or corporate setting.
cons: Very physical; lifting, pushing, bending amd etc... Schedule can range within a week from 6 am to 11 pm.
